choices.text: Both A and R are true, and R is the correct explanation of A
Both A and R are true, but R is not the correct explanation of A
A is true but R is false
A is false but R is true

questions.text:
Assertion (A): Lipid A component of lipopolysaccharide is responsible for the endotoxic activity of Gram-negative bacteria.
Reason (R): Lipid A activates macrophages to release IL-1 and TNF-α.
questions.solution: Ans. A) Both A and R are true, and R is the correct explanation of A

choices.text: Adults attach to the large intestine mucosa using hooks
Infection occurs via ingestion of embryonated eggs
Worms secrete neurotoxins causing neurological symptoms
Eggs are immediately infectious once passed in stool

questions.text: A 7-year-old from a rural area presents with abdominal pain and passing long, creamy-white worms. Stool wet mount shows thick, non-segmented worms; ova are spherical with a mammillated shell. Which statement is true?
questions.solution: Ans. B) Infection occurs via ingestion of embryonated eggs

questions.text: A 30-year-old male presents with profuse watery diarrhea after eating street food. Laboratory tests suggest bacterial toxin-mediated secretion. Which of the following toxins does not exert its effect by increasing intracellular cAMP?
questions.solution: Ans. D) Shiga toxin (Shigella dysenteriae)

choices.text: Both A and R are true, and R is the correct explanation of A
Both A and R are true, but R is not the correct explanation of A
A is true but R is false
A is false but R is true

questions.text:
Assertion (A): IgA provides mucosal immunity.
Reason (R): It activates complement via the classical pathway.
questions.solution: Ans. C) A is true but R is false

questions.text: A 45-year-old immunocompromised patient (HIV positive, CD4 count 50/µL) presents with headache, fever, and neck stiffness. CSF analysis shows elevated opening pressure, lymphocytic pleocytosis, and low glucose. An India ink preparation of CSF is given below. Which stain can be used to visualize the capsule of this organism?
questions.solution: Ans. B) Mucicarmine stain

questions.text: A 5-year-old boy presents with fever and sore throat. Examination reveals a thick grayish membrane over the tonsils that bleeds on removal. Albert stain shows the following image. What other stain can be used to visualize this organism?
questions.solution: Ans. A) Ponder’s

questions.text: A 35-year-old man presents with progressive shortness of breath and dry cough after working for several months in a grain storage facility. Chest X-ray shows diffuse interstitial infiltrates, and lung biopsy reveals lymphocytic infiltration with granuloma formation. Which type of hypersensitivity reaction is primarily responsible for his condition?
questions.solution: Ans. D) T-cell mediated, delayed-type reaction

questions.text: Match the following parasites with their characteristic features:
questions.solution: Ans. A) A-2, B-1, C-3, D-4

questions.text: A 30-year-old farmer presents with the image shown below. Which of the following is the descriptive name for the microscopic finding of this organism causing this disease?
questions.solution: Ans. A) Medlar Bodies

choices.text: Oocysts are shed in human feces and are immediately infectious.
Tachyzoites replicate intracellularly in intermediate hosts and cause tissue damage.
Bradyzoites are the rapidly dividing form responsible for acute infection.
Cats act as intermediate hosts where sexual reproduction occurs in muscle tissue.

questions.text: A 25-year-old pregnant woman presents for routine prenatal checkup. She reports no symptoms, but serology shows IgM positive for Toxoplasma gondii. She owns a cat and handles raw meat frequently. Which of the following statements about the life cycle of Toxoplasma gondii is correct?
questions.solution: Ans. B) Tachyzoites replicate intracellularly in intermediate hosts and cause tissue damage.

choices.text: HIV primarily infects CD8+ T lymphocytes, leading to immunodeficiency.
Gp120 envelope glycoprotein binds to CD4 receptor and CCR5/CXCR4 co-receptors to enter host cells.
The reverse transcriptase enzyme converts viral DNA into RNA.
HIV infection leads to B-cell depletion as the main mechanism of immunodeficiency.

questions.text: A 32-year-old man presents with persistent fever, weight loss, oral candidiasis, and recurrent diarrhea. He reports unprotected sexual contact with multiple partners. Which of the following statements about HIV pathogenesis is correct?
questions.solution: Ans. B) Gp120 envelope glycoprotein binds to CD4 receptor and CCR5/CXCR4 co-receptors to enter host cells

choices.text: Produces protein A, which binds the Fc region of IgG and helps evade phagocytosis
Causes puerperal fever as the most common manifestation
Exhibits alpha-hemolysis on blood agar and is optochin sensitive

questions.text: A 50-year-old male with a recent IV catheter develops fever and chills. Blood culture grows Gram-positive cocci in clusters, catalase positive, coagulase positive. Which of the following is also a feature of this organism?
questions.solution: Ans. A) Produces protein A, which binds the Fc region of IgG and helps evade phagocytosis

questions.text: Match the following bacteria with their characteristic laboratory features:
questions.solution: Ans. A) A-2, B-1, C-4, D-3

choices.text: Bacillus cereus produces a heat-stable emetic toxin, causing vomiting within 1–6 hours.
Bacillus cereus produces a heat-labile diarrheal toxin, causing diarrhea 8–16 hours after ingestion.
Bacillus cereus is a Gram-negative bacillus that invades the intestinal mucosa.
Bacillus cereus infection usually causes bloody diarrhea with high fever.

questions.text: A 30-year-old man develops profuse watery diarrhea and abdominal cramps about 10 hours after eating fried rice at a buffet. No vomiting or fever is noted. Several others who ate the same food developed similar symptoms. Which of the following statements about the causative organism is correct?
questions.solution: Ans. B) Bacillus cereus produces a heat-labile diarrheal toxin, causing diarrhea 8–16 hours after ingestion

questions.text: Which of the following will activate the area marked by the arrow in the image?
questions.solution: Ans. A) Streptococcus pyogenes exotoxin

questions.text: Match the following viruses with disease:
questions.solution: Ans. D) A-3, B-1, C-2, D-4

choices.text: Low IgG avidity indicates a recent primary infection
High IgG avidity suggests infection within the past 1–2 weeks
IgG avidity measures the quantity of antibodies, not their binding strength
Avidity testing is useful only for IgM-negative cases

questions.text: A 28-year-old pregnant woman undergoes routine serology for Rubella. Her results show positive IgM and low IgG avidity. Which of the following statements is correct regarding IgG avidity testing?
questions.solution: Ans. A) Low IgG avidity indicates a recent primary infection

questions.text: A 30-year-old pregnant woman presents with mild fever and diarrhea after consuming unpasteurized cheese. Her newborn develops neonatal sepsis and meningitis. CSF culture shows Gram-positive bacilli that is motile at 25°C but non-motile at 37°C. Which of the following laboratory tests can be performed to confirm the diagnosis of this organism?
questions.solution: Ans. A) Catalase test and CAMP test

choices.text: It shows acute-angle, aseptate hyphae on microscopy
It is a rapidly invasive fungus causing angioinvasion and tissue necrosis
It is best treated with fluconazole monotherapy

questions.text: A 55-year-old man with uncontrolled diabetes presents with facial pain, nasal congestion, blackish nasal discharge, and swelling around the eye. A KOH mount of nasal scrapings shows broad, ribbon-like, non-septate hyphae. Which of the following is true about this organism?
questions.solution: Ans. C) It is a rapidly invasive fungus causing angioinvasion and tissue necrosis

choices.text: Japanese encephalitis virus is a DNA virus of the Herpesviridae family
It is transmitted by Culex mosquitoes, with pigs and birds as amplifying hosts
Humans serve as the primary reservoir, sustaining the virus cycle
Infection commonly causes asymptomatic hemorrhagic fever

questions.text: A 7-year-old boy from a rural village in India presents with high-grade fever, headache, vomiting, and confusion for 3 days. His parents report recent mosquito bites near rice paddies. On examination, he has neck stiffness, hypertonia, and tremors. Which of the following statements about the causative agent is correct?
questions.solution: Ans. B) It is transmitted by Culex mosquitoes, with pigs and birds as amplifying hosts

choices.text: Polypeptide capsule demonstrated by M’Fadyean stain
Growth enhanced in high-salt (7.5% NaCl) medium

questions.text: A 35-year-old farmer presents with a painless ulcer on his hand with a black eschar surrounded by edema. He reports handling animal hides recently. Gram stain of lesion exudate shows large Gram-positive bacilli in chains. Which of the following is the most characteristic laboratory feature of this organism?
questions.solution: Ans. A) Polypeptide capsule demonstrated by M’Fadyean stain

choices.text: Late-onset prosthetic valve endocarditis (PVE) is most commonly caused by Staphylococcus aureus and occurs within 60 days of surgery
Coagulase-negative staphylococci (CoNS) are frequent causes of late-onset PVE, often associated with biofilm formation on the prosthetic material
Late-onset PVE is typically due to oral streptococci, years after surgery
PVE rarely requires surgical intervention, as antibiotics alone are sufficient

questions.text: A 60-year-old man with a mechanical aortic valve implanted 3 years ago presents with fever, malaise, and new-onset heart murmur. Blood cultures grow Gram-positive cocci in chains, catalase negative & coagulase negative. Which of the following statements about this condition is true?
questions.solution: Ans. C) Late-onset PVE is typically due to oral streptococci, years after surgery

choices.text: Low antibody titer leading to failure of visible flocculation
Prozone phenomenon: very high antibody titers interfere with antigen-antibody lattice formation
The causative organism lacks cardiolipin antigens, leading to false negativity
Antibodies are IgM type, which do not react in VDRL

questions.text: Suspecting syphilis, his physician performs a VDRL test, which comes back falsely negative despite strong clinical suspicion. Which of the following explains this result?
questions.solution: Ans. B) Prozone phenomenon: very high antibody titers interfere with antigen-antibody lattice formation

choices.text: Catalase positive, optochin resistant, bile insoluble
Catalase negative, optochin sensitive, bile soluble
Catalase negative, optochin resistant, bile insoluble
Catalase positive, optochin sensitive, bile soluble

questions.text: A 45-year-old man presents with sudden-onset fever, productive cough with rusty sputum, and pleuritic chest pain. Blood culture grows the following image shown below. Which of the following biochemical features is characteristic of this organism?
questions.solution: Ans. B) Catalase negative, optochin sensitive, bile soluble

choices.text: Alcohol-based hand rub for 20 seconds is sufficient
Washing hands with soap and water for at least 40–60 seconds
Wearing gloves alone eliminates the need for hand hygiene
Hand sanitizer is more effective than soap and water when hands are visibly dirty

questions.text: A 32-year-old nurse in a busy ICU is caring for multiple patients, including a post-operative immunocompromised patient. She notices visible soiling of her hands after handling a patient’s bedpan. Which of the following is the most appropriate hand hygiene measure in this scenario?
questions.solution: Ans. B) Washing hands with soap and water for at least 40–60 seconds

choices.text: Chlamydia trachomatis L1–L3 serovars – intracytoplasmic inclusion bodies in epithelial cells
Treponema pallidum – dark-field microscopy positive spirochetes
Neisseria gonorrhoeae – Gram-negative intracellular diplococci in urethral smear
Haemophilus ducreyi – school of fish appearance on Gram stain

questions.text: A 30-year-old man presents with a painless genital ulcer for 1 week, followed by painful inguinal lymphadenopathy on the same side. He reports unprotected sexual contact with a new partner. Which of the following is the most likely causative organism and diagnostic feature?
questions.solution: Ans. A) Chlamydia trachomatis L1–L3 serovars – intracytoplasmic inclusion bodies in epithelial cells

choices.text: It is a true fungus, and hyphal invasion is seen in tissue
The infection is acquired primarily via respiratory droplet inhalation from infected humans
It is an aquatic protist, previously classified as a fungus
Histopathology also shows budding yeast cells in clusters, giving a “spaghetti and meatballs” appearance

questions.text: A 35-year-old man from rural southern India presents with a slowly enlarging, painless, reddish polyp in his right nasal cavity, which friably bleeds on minor trauma. He reports frequent bathing in local ponds. Histopathology of a biopsy shows thick-walled sporangia containing numerous endospores, surrounded by granulomatous inflammation. Which of the following statements about this organism is correct?
questions.solution: Ans. C) It is an aquatic protist, previously classified as a fungus

choices.text: NS1 antigen-mediated complement activation leading to endothelial damage
Antibody-dependent enhancement (ADE): non-neutralizing antibodies from the previous infection facilitate viral entry into monocytes
IgG antibodies doesn’t neutralize the virus effectively, causing severe disease
T-cell mediated hypersensitivity reaction is the main cause of plasma leakage

questions.text: A 28-year-old man from a dengue-endemic area presents with high-grade fever, severe myalgia, retro-orbital pain, and petechial rash with rising hematocrit. He had a documented dengue infection 2 years ago. Which of the following mechanisms explains why his current infection may be more severe than the previous one?
questions.solution: Ans. B) Antibody-dependent enhancement (ADE): non-neutralizing antibodies from the previous infection facilitate viral entry into monocytes

questions.text: A 28-year-old immunocompromised man with HIV/AIDS presents with profuse, watery diarrhea for 2 weeks, accompanied by cramping abdominal pain and weight loss. Stool microscopy using modified acid-fast stain shows oocysts, 20–33 µm in diameter. Which of the following is the most likely causative parasite?
questions.solution: Ans. A) Cystoisospora belli

questions.text: A 50-year-old man presents with sudden-onset severe pain and swelling in his right leg after a deep laceration. The affected tissue is crepitant, with brownish foul-smelling exudate. All of the following features are present in this organism except?
questions.solution: Ans. D)

choices.text: Midstream clean-catch urine collected before starting antibiotics
Random urine sample, irrespective of timing
Blood culture as urine culture is unnecessary in uncomplicated cases

questions.text: A 40-year-old man presents with fever, dysuria, and right flank tenderness for 2 days. Laboratory tests reveal pyuria and bacteriuria. The clinician suspects acute pyelonephritis due to Escherichia coli. Which of the following is the most appropriate sample to collect for accurate microbiological diagnosis, minimizing contamination?
questions.solution: Ans. A) Midstream clean-catch urine collected before starting antibiotics

questions.text: A 26-year-old man visited a rabies clinic for administration of anti-rabies immunoglobulin after getting bitten by a dog. What kind of immunity is this?
questions.solution: Ans. D) Artificial passive

choices.text: Growth in MacConkey and blood agar but not chocolate agar
Growth in MacConkey and chocolate agar but not blood agar
Growth in blood agar and chocolate agar but not MacConkey
Growth in all blood, chocolate and MacConkey agar

questions.text: True regarding H. influenza growth:
questions.solution: Ans. C) Growth in blood agar and chocolate agar but not MacConkey

questions.text:
A 40-year-old man develops acute watery diarrhea and abdominal cramps about 12 hours after eating raw seafood. Laboratory culture grows halophilic, Gram-negative curved rods. Which of the following statements about the causative organism are correct? 

A. It is halophilic and thrives in saltwater environments
B. It produces cholera-like enterotoxin causing severe watery diarrhea
C. Infection is commonly associated with raw or undercooked seafood consumption
D. It is a Gram-positive bacillus and ferments lactose on MacConkey agar
E. It typically causes self-limiting gastroenteritis in healthy adults
questions.solution: Ans. A) A, C, E

questions.text: A 28-year-old woman presents with high fever, malaise, and a vesicular rash on the trunk and face. She reports exposure to her younger sibling who recently had chickenpox. A Tzanck smear shows multinucleated giant cells with intranuclear inclusions. Which of the following is the causative virus?
questions.solution: Ans. A) Varicella-zoster virus (VZV)

questions.text: Match the antibody with its usual structure/form:
questions.solution: Ans. A) A-2, B-3, C-1, D-4

questions.text: A 30-year-old male presents to the emergency department with profuse, watery diarrhoea for the past 24 hours. He reports passing large volumes of pale, rice-water-like stools without blood or mucus. On examination, he has dry mucous membranes, sunken eyes, and poor skin turgor. Stool sample was sent for culture and showed this image. Identify the culture media used.
questions.solution: Ans. A) TCBS

questions.text: A 32 year old male presented with fever with joint pains and hepatosplenomegaly. He mentions drinking unpasteurized milk after which he started to develop symptoms. The blood culture grew smooth, non-haemolytic colonies that were catalase and oxidase positive. What is the gold standard test for the diagnosis of this disease?
questions.solution: Ans. C) Standard agglutination test

questions.text: A 30 year old male presented to the STD clinic with single, painless ulcer on his penile shaft since 3 days. He reports having unprotected sexual intercourse with multiple women. The sample was taken from the ulcer and showed this image. Identify the test performed.
questions.solution: Ans. B) Dark ground microscopy

questions.text: All the disease in spotted fever group of the rickettsiae genera is transmitted by tick except:
questions.solution: Ans. C) R. akarii

questions.text: A 35-year-old male presents to the emergency department with severe abdominal pain, diarrhea, and a fever. He recently returned from a trip to a rural area in Southeast Asia. Stool examination reveals this picture. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.solution: Ans. C) Entamoeba histolytica infection

questions.text: A 45-year-old man from a tropical region presents with significant swelling of his right leg and groin, along with fever and chills. He mentions that he often travels to areas known for mosquito-borne diseases. A blood smear reveals sheathed microfilariae with no nuclei in the tail tip. Which of the following microfilaria shows this picture?
questions.solution: Ans. A) Wuchereria bancrofti

questions.text: A 30-year-old male presents with pruritic, scaly lesions on his groin and inner thighs. He reports that the rash has been persistent and worsens during warm, humid weather. A fungal culture revealed this image. What is the most likely organism causing this disease?
questions.solution: Ans. D) Epidermophyton spp

choices.text: Round to oval cysts with thick black walls, often in clusters
Broad, non-septate hyphae with right-angle branching

questions.text: A 30-year-old male with a history of HIV presents with a persistent dry cough, fever, and progressive shortness of breath over the past month. He has a CD4 count of 150 cells/mm³. A chest X-ray shows bilateral ground-glass opacities. A bronchoalveolar lavage (BAL) specimen is sent for staining. What would be the finding of this organism on Gomori methenamine silver stain?
questions.solution: Ans. A) Round to oval cysts with thick black walls, often in clusters

questions.text: A 32-year-old man presents with malaise, anorexia, dark-colored urine, and mild jaundice for the past 5 days. He also complains of right upper quadrant discomfort. He reports unprotected sexual intercourse with a new partner 4 weeks ago. On examination, he has icterus and mild hepatomegaly. Laboratory tests show elevated ALT and AST (3–4 times normal). Which of the following serological markers is the earliest to appear during acute Hepatitis B virus (HBV) infection?
questions.solution: Ans. A) HBsAg (Hepatitis B surface antigen)

choices.text: Stool culture on CCFA (cycloserine-cefoxitin-fructose agar) to isolate any Clostridium species
Stool ELISA or PCR for C. difficile toxins A and B
Stool cytotoxin assay using Vero cells to detect cell-rounding activity
Detection of Gram-positive rods with subterminal spores on stool smear

questions.text: A 65-year-old woman presents with profuse watery diarrhea, abdominal cramps, and low-grade fever for 4 days. She recently completed a 7-day course of broad-spectrum antibiotics for pneumonia. On examination, her abdomen is mildly distended with diffuse tenderness. Colonoscopy shows adherent yellowish-white plaques on the colonic mucosa. Which of the following laboratory tests is most definitive for confirming the causative organism?
questions.solution: Ans. B) Stool ELISA or PCR for C. difficile toxins A and B

choices.text: It is a flagellated, thermophilic protozoan that causes primary amoebic meningoencephalitis (PAM)
Infection occurs primarily via ingestion of contaminated water, leading to intestinal colonization
The trophozoite is non-motile; only the cyst form is infectious
The disease is usually self-limiting in immunocompetent hosts

questions.text: A 12-year-old boy presents with sudden-onset severe headache, high fever, nausea, and vomiting for 2 days. His parents report that he recently swam in a warm freshwater lake. On examination, he is disoriented with neck stiffness. CSF analysis shows high neutrophils, low glucose, and elevated protein. Wet mount of CSF shows motile trophozoites. Which of the following statements about the causative organism is correct?
questions.solution: Ans. A) It is a flagellated, thermophilic protozoan that causes primary amoebic meningoencephalitis (PAM)

questions.text: A 28-year-old man returns from a beach vacation in Goa. He presents with an intensely itchy, serpiginous, raised lesion on his foot as shown in the image. Which of the following is the most likely causative organism?
questions.solution: Ans. C) Ancylostoma braziliense

questions.text: Match the inclusion body with the correct organism:
questions.solution: Ans. A) 1-b, 2-a, 3-c, 4-d

choices.text: Diagnostic of S. Paratyphi A infection
Indicates acute mixed infection with S. Typhi and S. Paratyphi A

questions.text:
A 32-year-old man presents with 8 days of high fever, headache, and abdominal discomfort. He had similar symptoms 2 months ago and recovered with antibiotics. On this visit, a Widal test done on Day 8 of fever shows:
TO: 1:120
TH: 1:200
AH: 1:360
BH: 1:80
What is the best interpretation of these findings?
questions.solution: Ans. D) Indicates acute mixed infection with S. Typhi and S. Paratyphi A

choices.text: It is caused by a dimorphic fungus that shows narrow based buddying
It primarily infects neutrophils, not macrophages
The infection is transmitted through person-to-person contact
Treatment is usually with oral fluconazole only

questions.text: A 45-year-old male farmer from the Ohio River Valley presents with fever, cough, weight loss, and multiple small skin nodules. Chest X-ray shows diffuse pulmonary infiltrates. A culture on Kelly’s media grew colonies. LPCB mount of the organism shows the following image. Which of the following is true about this infection?
questions.solution: Ans. A) It is caused by a dimorphic fungus that shows narrow based buddying

questions.text: All the diseases can be caused by Parvovirus B19 except:
questions.solution: Ans. D) Exanthem subitem

questions.text: A 24-year-old medical student from Mumbai is scheduled for a clinical elective in the USA. She is required to undergo screening for latent tuberculosis before entering the hospital. She has taken BCG vaccine in infancy. She is asymptomatic, and her chest X-ray is normal. All are used to detect latent TB except:
questions.solution: Ans. D) CBNAAT

questions.text: Match the following:
questions.solution: Ans. B) 1-c, 2-d, 3-b, 4-e, 5-a

questions.text: A hospitalized patient with a urinary catheter develops a multidrug-resistant Klebsiella pneumoniae infection. Investigation shows the resistance genes are located on a plasmid, and the same plasmid is later identified in E. coli isolates from another patient in the ICU. Which of the following best explains the spread of resistance in this scenario?
questions.solution: Ans. C) Conjugation

questions.text:
A 21-year-old previously healthy male presents to the ER with high-grade fever, altered sensorium, neck stiffness, and hypotension. On examination, he is febrile, drowsy, and has petechial rashes over his lower limbs.
CSF shows increased pressure, Glucose: (↓), Protein: (↑), WBC count: 90% neutrophils Gram stain of CSF shows this image. Which of the following features is most characteristic of the causative organism?
questions.solution: Ans. B) Capsule with multiple serogroups

choices.text: Mycoplasma pneumoniae is a Gram-negative bacillus with a thick peptidoglycan cell wall
It lacks a cell wall, making it resistant to beta-lactam antibiotics
Infection is commonly zoonotic, transmitted from livestock
It cannot be grown on artificial media

questions.text: A 25-year-old man presents with dry cough, low-grade fever, malaise, and sore throat for 2 weeks. Chest X-ray shows findings suggestive of atypical pneumonia. He has no significant past medical history. Which of the following statements about the likely causative organism is true?
questions.solution: Ans. B) It lacks a cell wall, making it resistant to beta-lactam antibiotics

questions.text: What is the stain used in this image?
questions.solution: Ans. D) Wayson’s

questions.text: Which of the following biomedical waste items is correctly matched with its color-coded disposal bag?
questions.solution: Ans. C) Human anatomical waste – Yellow bag

choices.text: It detects a fungal cell wall component present in most fungi except Cryptococcus and Mucorales
It is specific for Candida albicans only
A negative result rules out all fungal infections, including cryptococcosis
It directly identifies the species of the fungus

questions.text: A 50-year-old immunocompromised woman presents with persistent fever despite broad-spectrum antibiotics. Blood cultures are negative, but she has tachycardia, hypotension, and signs of sepsis. The clinician suspects an invasive fungal infection. Which of the following statements about the (1→3)-β-D-glucan assay is true?
questions.solution: Ans. A) It detects a fungal cell wall component present in most fungi except Cryptococcus and Mucorales

choices.text: Overgrowth of Gardnerella vaginalis and anaerobes leading to depletion of Lactobacillus and clue cells
Presence of pseudohyphae and budding yeast cells on KOH mount
Detection of motile flagellated protozoa on wet mount
Purulent cervical discharge with Gram-negative intracellular diplococci

questions.text: A 28-year-old woman presents with thin, grayish vaginal discharge with a fishy odor, worse after sexual intercourse. She denies dysuria or fever. Vaginal examination shows homogeneous discharge coating the vaginal walls. Microscopy reveals clue cells. Which of the following is the most likely causative organism or hallmark finding of this condition?
questions.solution: Ans. A) Overgrowth of Gardnerella vaginalis and anaerobes leading to depletion of Lactobacillus and clue cells

questions.text: A 40-year-old gardener presents with a painless ulcer on his hand, followed by the appearance of nodular lesions along lymphatic channels of the arm. Biopsy from the lesion shows this image. What is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.solution: Ans. B) Sporothrix schenckii

questions.text: A 35-year-old surgeon is preparing surgical instruments for a complex operation. The instruments include metal scissors, forceps, and rubber suction tubing. She wants a method that kills all forms of microbial life, including spores, without damaging heat-sensitive materials. Which of the following is the most appropriate sterilization method in this scenario?
questions.solution: Ans. C) Ethylene oxide gas sterilization

choices.text: Kirby-Bauer disk diffusion, measuring the zone of inhibition around antibiotic disks on agar
E-test, using a gradient strip to determine minimum inhibitory concentration (MIC)
Automated broth microdilution systems providing rapid MIC and categorical interpretation

questions.text: A 45-year-old patient with sepsis has blood cultures positive for Gram-negative bacilli. The microbiology lab wants to determine the antibiotic susceptibility to guide therapy. Which of the following methods accurately determines whether the organism is susceptible, intermediate, or resistant?
questions.solution: Ans. D) All of the above

choices.text: Detection of histidine-rich protein II (HRP-II) antigen in blood
Identification of enlarged RBCs with Schuffner’s dots
Observation of round gametocytes with single ring forms per RBC

questions.text: A 32-year-old man returns from West Africa with high-grade intermittent fever, chills, malaise, and mild jaundice. Laboratory investigations show anemia, thrombocytopenia. Peripheral blood smear shows RBCs with multiple delicate ring forms, some crescent-shaped gametocytes. Which of the following diagnostic features or tests is most specific for identifying the causative organism?
questions.solution: Ans. A) Detection of histidine-rich protein II (HRP-II) antigen in blood

choices.text: Biofilms consist of bacterial communities embedded in an extracellular polymeric matrix, which protects them from antibiotics and host defenses
Biofilm-associated bacteria are always more virulent than planktonic forms
Biofilms are only formed by Gram-positive bacteria
Disruption of biofilms is unnecessary, as antibiotic therapy alone is usually sufficient

questions.text: A 55-year-old diabetic patient with a long-term urinary catheter develops recurrent urinary tract infections despite multiple courses of antibiotics. Laboratory testing reveals multidrug-resistant E. coli. Which of the following statements about bacterial biofilms best explains this clinical scenario?
questions.solution: Ans. A) Biofilms consist of bacterial communities embedded in an extracellular polymeric matrix, which protects them from antibiotics and host defenses

choices.text: Stationary phase, where the rate of bacterial growth equals the rate of bacterial death due to nutrient depletion and waste accumulation
Lag phase, where bacteria are metabolically inactive and adapting to the new medium
Exponential (log) phase, where bacteria multiply at a constant, maximal rate
Death phase, where bacterial death exceeds growth

questions.text: A microbiology student inoculates a pure culture of E. coli into fresh nutrient broth and measures optical density (OD) at regular intervals over 24 hours. The resulting growth curve shows a brief lag phase, a steep rise in OD, followed by a plateau, and eventually a decline. Which of the following statements best describes the phase represented by the plateau in OD?
questions.solution: Ans. A) Stationary phase, where the rate of bacterial growth equals the rate of bacterial death due to nutrient depletion and waste accumulation

questions.text: Which of the following fungi would not typically require a shift to a higher temperature to induce a morphological change from mold to yeast?
questions.solution: Ans. A) Coccidioides immitis

choices.text: Faster growth rate of Cryptococcus species
Selective inhibition of contaminating bacteria and fungi
Direct visualization of melanin production, aiding in identification

questions.text: In the laboratory diagnosis of cryptococcal infection, what is the primary advantage of using NIGER Seed Agar over other non-selective media?
questions.solution: Ans. D) Direct visualization of melanin production, aiding in identification

questions.text: A 28-year-old pregnant woman returns from a trip to Brazil and develops low-grade fever, maculopapular rash, and conjunctivitis. She is concerned due to news reports linking this illness to fetal abnormalities. Infection with this virus is most likely transmitted by which of the following vectors?
questions.solution: Ans. C)

choices.text: Only acid-fast bacteria will be visible
No bacteria will retain the stain

questions.text: A microbiologist stains a sputum smear using Ziehl-Neelsen method. On microscopy, the technician accidentally skips the acid wash step. What is the likely effect of this error?
questions.solution: Ans. A) All bacteria will appear acid-fast

questions.text:
Which of the following statements about haptens is/are true?

  1. Haptens can bind to antibodies but cannot initiate an immune response by themselves.
  2. Complex haptens are usually univalent and cannot form visible immune complexes.
  3. A hapten-carrier conjugate can generate antibodies against both hapten and carrier.
  4. Haptens must be proteinaceous in structure to bind antibodies.
  5. Simple haptens can be visualized using precipitation reactions due to cross-linking ability.
questions.solution: Ans. A) 1 and 3

choices.text: Direct contact with water or soil contaminated with urine of infected animals (rodents, livestock)

questions.text: A 35-year-old farmer presents with sudden-onset high fever, severe myalgia (especially calf muscles), conjunctival suffusion, and dark-colored urine. He reports wading through floodwater on his farm last week. Laboratory tests reveal elevated bilirubin and mild thrombocytopenia. Which of the following is the primary route of transmission for the causative organism?
questions.solution: Ans. A) Direct contact with water or soil contaminated with urine of infected animals (rodents, livestock)

choices.text: Both A and R are true, and R is the correct explanation of A
Both A and R are true, but R is not the correct explanation of A
A is true, R is false
A is false, R is true

questions.text:
Assertion (A): Legionella pneumophila infection often causes atypical pneumonia with hyponatremia and gastrointestinal symptoms.

Reason (R): Legionella grows well on standard blood agar and MacConkey agar.Both A and R are true, and R is the correct explanation of A
questions.solution: Ans. C) A is true, R is false

questions.text:
Staphylococcus aureus is a versatile pathogen causing a range of infections. Which of the following statements are true? 

A. Coagulase production by S. aureus helps the bacteria evade host immune defenses by forming fibrin clots around itself
B. S. aureus can cause toxin-mediated diseases, including toxic shock syndrome, scalded skin syndrome, and staphylococcal food poisoning
C. Methicillin-resistant S. aureus (MRSA) is intrinsically resistant to vancomycin and all glycopeptides
D. Formation of biofilms on medical devices and heart valves contributes to recurrent and persistent infections
E. S. aureus is a Gram-negative coccus arranged in chains
questions.solution: Ans. A) A, B, D
